item.title: Reddit CEO doubles down on attack on Apollo developer in drama-filled AMA
item.description: - Reddit CEO Steve Huffman continues to defend the company's unpopular decision to revise its API pricing, leading to the closure of third-party apps, including Apollo.

item.title: ArchiveTeam has saved over 11.2B Reddit links
item.description: - ArchiveTeam has saved over 10.8 billion Reddit links and is trying to archive subreddits before they disappear due to Reddit's API cost system change.

item.title: June 2023 Data Dump is missing
item.description: - Stack Overflow has not released its June 2023 data dump, which is typically updated every three months, and senior leadership has disabled its upload to Archive.org.

item.title: Reddark: Website to watch subreddits going dark
item.description: - This page does not have a main article.

item.title: Apollo Back end just made public
item.description: - Developer of Apollo, a Reddit app for iPhone, has made the code for its backend repository publicly available to demonstrate that Apollo does not scrape any data and solely relies on authenticated Reddit API requests.

item.title: Archive your Reddit data before it's too late
item.description: - Upcoming changes to Reddit's API may cause some subreddits to go dark indefinitely and affect third-party clients.

item.title: Shreddit is a Python program to remove all your Reddit comments
item.description: - Shreddit is a Python command line program that removes a user's post history on Reddit systematically, leaving only those whitelisted.

item.title: OpenMW: Open-source TES3: Morrowind reimplementation
item.description: - OpenMW is an open-source game engine that supports playing the game Morrowland.

item.title: I bought the only physical encyclopedia still in print
item.description: - World Book Encyclopedia is the only updated book encyclopedia in print.

item.title: 3M heads to trial in 'existential' $143B forever-chemicals litigation
item.description: - 3M faces the first trial out of 4,000 lawsuits, with an estimated liability of $143 billion for the cleanup of allegedly cancer-linked "forever chemicals" that have contaminated municipal water supplies.
